comment.body:
ZeroMe currently doesn't have this feature. As a temporary solution you can clone a hub for specific group and invite others to join your hub, I've made a [pull request](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/pull/100) for adding hub timeline, but it's still not merged. You can try my [ZeroMe clone](/1G9wPKCvqdzZVRzZizcsExhYufMpAxbh6U/) for it or ask the main dev to merge it to official ZeroMe.
You can also just clone a ZeroTalk for specific group and discussion.

It should work if there are peers serving all the optional files. There is an option to run zeronet and serve all optional files of a site. Another idea: host Wikipedia zim files as optional files and create a kiwix js app, I'm using [kiwix-cli](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/kiwix-cli-git) and I can browse Wikipedia from its Web UI

@Bluishcoder: Probably not necessary, so it depends on your interest. IPFS before also created a [wikipeidia hosting project](https://ipfs.io/blog/24-uncensorable-wikipedia/) when Turkey censored Wikipedia. But the project now [looks deprecated](https://github.com/ipfs/distributed-wikipedia-mirror).
Get well soon! Regular exercise keeps most diseases away ;)

Getting DNS over TLS is really good news! Just hope that one day TLS Servers are also decentralized. I know little about TLS, but guess it will be something like this: [HTTPS Server without a public/static IP. TLS Tunnels with decentralized credentials.](https://github.com/beameio/beame-sdk)

Yup, that is a severe issue. Thx for sharing. Btw, it's [in the TODO list](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet-kivy): 
> Keep users.json and other sensitive data in internal private directory of the APP, out of other APPs' reach.
@Musickiller: Do you also use the app for your main account on Android?
@Clematis: This may help: [Linux Deploy](https://github.com/meefik/linuxdeploy/)
@Zefinity-Inf: Thx for the info
XD +1 "Include too large 897B > 0B"

@Shouko: For me ZeroBlog is still the most decentralized and therefore my favorite on ZeroNet. Have you checked [0gallery](/0gallery.bit) by 空澄砂夜? The content is also totally in owner's control and it has hubs!
@Shouko: >< That's what I want to express too.
@P2P: Sure. Nice work!

> I won't be able to update my repos
Could you explain it?
I tried many times to publish my repo to clearnet proxy and failed, but some time later it auto-published!
And a suggestion: Instead of auto-redirecting repo address to Git Center, can you provide a button in the repo zite for redirecting?
So user can edit her/his repo zite from config panel. -> [My repo as an example](/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV)
--- ---
I find that Repository Index and My Repos are using repo address, so auto-redirecting is a bit more convienient than a button. Krixano's suggestion (by appending /1 to it so you aren't redirected to Git Center, then slide open the sidebar) is enough for accessing config panel.

Before user could create channel from the "All Channel" page. The feature is probably disabled by the author for some reasons, or just a bug. You can file an issue in [its Github Repo](http://github.com/zer0net/zerovoat)
@Git Center: I think that's not necessary. Adding /1 or anything is enough to bypass redirecting. Later you may like to add this trick to FAQ :)

> can I create a private zite and only have it be accessible by people who know the link to it?
You can. As there is no global index and crawler, and when you publish a site, practically only the user who finds the link can open it. Also an advanced version of private site is [in the todo list](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/62)
@Vizy93: I think you can check [the stats page](/Stats) or ZeroNet log for related info. If the user is using tor, then... Haven't looked into details about this.
Welcome back :D

Guess you are using Torbrowser or sth simllar: Here is [the explanation](https://tor.stackexchange.com/questions/3283/html5-canvas-security-flaw)
> After plugins and plugin-provided information, we believe that the HTML5 Canvas is the single largest fingerprinting threat browsers face today...
> To reduce the threat from this vector, we have patched Firefox to prompt before returning valid image data to the Canvas APIs. If the user hasn't previously allowed the site in the URL bar to access Canvas image data, pure white image data is returned to the Javascript APIs.

Haven't found a solution for it yet. So you need to use another browser to upload image on ZeroMe.
--- ---
Firefox nightly and upcoming Firefox 58 also introduces this feature: https://www.ghacks.net/2017/10/28/firefox-58-warns-you-if-sites-use-canvas-image-data/
But for ZeroNet the permission prompt doens't show up in Torbrowser

Sorry to raise some opposite opinions. Before I studied life sciences in a Uni. I'm not a professor for such a topic, but vegatables and plants somehow also have nervous system (you can search for papers about it). They know pain and react to harm. They're just much more distant relatives to us compare to animals.
Life is cruel, but still we can gradually reduce the cruelity of life (though having enough concept about cruelity is also important for dealing with it) :)

@Krixano: I don't have that problem, newest torrent is submitted about 17 hours ago. If I search with space character, there are around 40 torrents now (there are more actually).
If I search with 0, one recent torrent "Vikings S05E01-E02.HDTV.x264-KILLERS[rarbg] -" is in the list, but if I search with e, two recent torrents "Cuphead" and "Popeye for President.avi" don't show up in the list.
@Krixano: That's weird. I guess you might download the zite a long time ago and the author made some big changes later. So your database needs to rebuild. But it seems there are some other issues.
@Krixano: Oops! It's from my side. After I rebuilt the database, I also have only 20 torrents now.

Another small fix request: as you see, from [the comment of my previous PR](/gitcenter.bit/repo/pull-requests/view/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/1@1PFWGebEqZssXXnM9u2gk7yJpXUoMPQG8D), the code exceeds far away from the page. You can add sth like
```
pre {overflow:auto}
```
to solve it.

@Git Center: Fixed. I'll try to make my code more general and cover more situations, so some small changes won't affect the dark theme. Btw, I find my repo name now [covers the star button](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV). You may need to do some tweak for long repo name.

XD, I think I'm the first one who did such a mischief. Instead I use bookmark to directly access my repo in Git Center. But since you say so, I've also changed my repo back. 
Even so it's still a bit tricky to access the side panel of the repo. You may like to add it to beginner's guide.
@Nofish: Instead you can access the config panel by adding sth lke /1 after the repo address to trigger a Not Found page, idea from Krixano.

@Krixano: Well... I just dug the database and this post was [where you mentioned that method](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1509655041), it would be nice if you credited him at that time. And... the misinfomation kept going on even after I [credited you to @Git Center](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/1510077454) ;_;
@Krixano: I agree. It's my mistake. I think next time I credit sth like this I'll just mention that it's from one's post but won't say it's his idea.

Yep, I set `body {background-color: #1b1b1b !important;}` so most zites has dark background, I don't set `background-image: none` because some zite owner may set a beautiful wallpaper, like ZeroMe Reload. Btw, I checked the code of that zite, looks like it uses clearnet javascript to mine Monero, so even you did this that zite is not nice at all X(
@Nofish: Works perfect with my Pi 2. Thank you very much!

@Git Center: I know. Imho that's still not good enough. Like, all the users contribue their cpu to one developer, such a thing makes me uncomfortable. And probably I'm a bit pananoid about centralized source. 
Coin mining will help website become independent from the ads system. I'm quite expecting about it. On the other hand, profit/money is important, but it can spoil lots of things, sad story...
@Git Center: Iirc only one `:params` is allowed for ZeroHello newsfeed cmd, and there are two in the code. Not very sure, if you change only one `:params` to the address and it works...

What about changing the title from `h1` to `h2`, `h1: 32px` is the default setting for many browsers [[ref]](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6140430/what-are-the-most-common-font-sizes-for-h1-h6-tags), it also affects comment and readme.

I agree with @Krixano, Vue.js fits ZeroNet ver well. I checked the src of ZeroGreeter (ZeroHello alternative, available on Git Center), and very impressive how little essential code is needed to create a multi-featured, flexible and robust zite. But I guess Coffeescript is still a go if you want to learn more about fundamental structure and low level of web dev, and how horrible JavaScript is...

@Mrsrobotmobile: [I understand](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1513215968) ;D For me one important feature of clearnet proxy is for bootstrapping new zites, so if it's disabled...

Have skip-watched about 5 videos :D Currently watching "Die göttliche Informatik / The divine Computer Science", downloading "Social Cooling - big data’s unintended side effect ", no torrent file is a bit pity.
Btw I've watched "May contain DTraces of FreeBSD", Have little concept about the topic and I can only understand a small part of the talk. The dirty cow vulnerability is an interesting case.
MuxZeroNet also created a [zerolib](https://github.com/MuxZeroNet/zerolib), totally different thing and first letters are not capitalized though
@Git Center: since your project is for assisting in developping new zite more easily and efficiently, what about ZeroDevLib?

Done :D Also I just replied to [your issue](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/1@1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di) on my messy repo, for some causes I didn't notice it on ZeroHello feed timeline before.

@Git Center: Before there was another Git Center repo `1BqUV9B3fdPTYvF7kCSC63rqz2Eykx6dAA` in the repo list, it's on my another machine and I couldn't open the repo in your post at the first time. After I delete that repo, your repo works now. The newest commit is `Update contributors - Ivanq commited on Nov 29 2017`

> Do you know what's happening?

@Git Center: bad network connection on your side probably, or you shutdown your ZeroNet server too early after publishing your repo, or your 15441 port is closed (no sure if this is related), or too many files (content.json 165K!) and ZeroNet server has hard time for publishing them all. Therefore, you failed to publish all files.
@Git Center: And gitcenter.git has 271 folders and 966 files. I wonder how much time is needed to publish them all to other peers.
@Git Center: Nofish created an admit.html for ZeroNet repo and only with text: "Nothing here :)" XD

@Git Center: some further interesting info:
| git folder | file | folder |
| --- | --- | --- |
| gitcenter.git | 966 | 271 |
| .git cloned from gitcenter | 176 | 94 |
| zeronet.git | 248 | 150 |
| .git cloned from ZeroNet github | 38 | 17 |
| my-messy-repo.git | 350 | 195 |

My repo has only 1 branch and 65 commits, what the heck! (Probably because I use a lot `git rebase -i` to merge commits of small changes, or Nofish manually deleted some unnecessary files inside)
Welcome to ZeroWorld :D

Then you may get more impressed that ZeroMe has an alternative frontend called [Sakana](/sakana.bit) ;) [[src on Git Center]](/15Z4H5K8YxjqGWpPxMLHWwr6Ve2nR7dz8d/) [[screenshot and UI tweak in my blog]](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:64)

@Git Center: @Putsan: For zite without merger sites you can also [create another main page](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:61) like naming it as `index2.html`, basically `dbschema.json` or your own `data.json` is all what you need
@Git Center: Nice comparison! My method is more suitable for doing some small local hack.
Shall I hit the like button?...

Thx for helping promote ZeroNet! One thing you may like to keep in mind: ZeroNet still has no high ability for anti-trolling. Illegal things, hatred stuff could be posted and discussed publicly, and sometimes trolling storm happens here. Sharing user block-list is one of Nofish's primary goals in 2018, and probably more things need to do to make ZeroNet more widely acceptable. Btw, I guess Nofish is still booking his TED talk, but the date is uncertain :)
@空澄砂夜 @ZeroLSTN

@Johnny Mnemonic: and for fairness I should add this: illegal and hate speech are not absolute, imho society/gov sometimes shouldn't directly punish/isolate individuals, or keep bombing related FUD news and social values (propaganda ~= agenda..) and the problems may come from society/gov/law itself. Such idea is probably hard to sell in mainstream though
@Nofish: me too, in both Firefox and Chromium, running in local mode or remote mode. Simply no reaction, nothing showed up in console log.
@Jamesholden: @Git Center: @Nofish: Updating to Rev 3223 solves the issue.

The UI doesn't have that feature, one way is by directly querying database, by `sqlite3 /path/to/zeronet/data/1up.../data/users/zeroup.db`, another way is by referencing src of big.kopykate.bit and adding it by yourself, or waiting for Nofish to implement it (it can be forever though XD)

User uploading to ZeroUp limit is 1GB, good for everyone. If you need larger space, try [IFS](/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/), [KopyKate big](/big.kopykate.bit), [Youtube](/149EPBN4hQRpwj5TcoPETepnoXHCUXzaCN/)... or roll your own ZeroUp like my [0-Share](/1Dphm8Mth9WYN9fPm1yxj8Y4WhcKRhYXJJ/)

Good job! I know that I can spy lots of "public" place with IP/CCTV "Security" cam, there is even [an opensource app](https://apt.izzysoft.de/fdroid/index/apk/io.evercam.androidapp), source code is huge and I still haven't checked it yet.
@ZeroLSTN: we need [lazy loading](?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1516586244) now ><

For font issue I solved it by directly adding `ttf-font-awesome` and `nodejs-material-design-icons font` to my system, looks nice enough for me.
If I don't add `proxy_set_header Host $host;` to `location /Websocket`, I receive `NS_ERROR_NOT_CONNECTED: ` and page content won't show up. Why don't you need that?
Also thx for the new config :D

@Lxpz: Thx! Add `ui_restrict` and `ui_host` and now it works without that config. Before I just collected different nginx config resources and only adding `--ui_ip 0.0.0.0` worked for me, your method is certainly more secure.

```
$ searchtext "no rules"
./src/Content/ContentManager.py:782:            raise VerifyError("No rules")
```
@Git Center: It has sth to do with `content.json`, probably you didn't set `"clone_root": "hub-template"` in it.
@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: @Git Center: That.. logo is a [kiwifruit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiwifruit), isn't it?
Interesting project! If possible, could you add notification (count of new newsfeed near the icon) from ZeroMe, ZeroTalk, etc?

@Jetten: Lxpz [explained the cause here and provide a solution for nginx setting](?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1LrDWSzi63MhST9ZNkefSPJGFAuByRMeCx/1516610853). For me installing ~~ttf-font-awesome~~ nodejs-material-design-icons font (Archlinux) solves the issue, too.

@Test20180221: yep if your are using a safe network, as password is transferred over insecure HTTP protocol [[ref]](?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR/1483533203)

@Test20180221: Don't know either. Does javascript encryption work in this situation? I only know that https is used for secure data transfer in the network, so guess need self-sign ssl cert and related support
@Test20180221: I haven't looked into the code, but guess data transfer in remote mode is different with the ZeroNet network itself, so many things need different/extra implementation

> Ah, additionally zeronet.py must need the client's public key as well to send zeronet.py's public key to the client privately.. 

@Test20180221: Yep, that's essential, the client needs public key ><
@Test20180221: That's a good idea, but does it work directly? Or still need some extra code in `plugins/UiPassword`? ssh as mentioned in the [ref] of my second comment is also nice I guess
@Test20180221: My pleasure, as an old user :D
@Cleberz: Played, really an interesting game!
[ZeroMe Language Character Filter and Hub Timeline](?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1503681678), and welcome to ZeroNet :D
Thanks! Awesome research and explanation! And learn something new: Middle Chinese

@leftside: I think "to see all of it." is the problem, which is not very possible, but "want to see all of it" is quite a good attitude for life :) Btw, I'm starting learning Hangul, I know some classmates was learning Korean when I was a high school student, but I didn't pay attention at that time. I also know a Korean foreign student who studied the same speciality with me in the university, once I saw him using the presentation computer in the classroom before the lecture began and surfing online in Korean XD My speciality is Biotechnology, btw.

@leftside: As a personal hobby of creating a constructed language and writing my thought in my native language. For various causes many words of Teochew don't have a Kanzi (or Hanzi in Mandarin), using Hanzi can't 100% preserve a language, which is also mentioned in the video above. One of my close friends is a phD graduate, and when we are chating online, he writes in Teochew mixing with broken Hanzi and Latin..

Hokkien (Taiwanese), a relative of Teochew, can be written in [Pe̍h-ōe-jī](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pe%CC%8Dh-%C5%8De-j%C4%AB). But it has heavy religious background and I guess it was not voluntary. And currently Taiwan is a conflict zone in politics, I'm even worried that if a war began, it might affect the place I live.. I traveled there before and I know quite some ridiculous examples of religion activities there (it's kind of big business btw).

@leftside: I didn't research my family lineage, I study science so I'm not conservative in most conditions and prefer not to talk too much about identity either. Anyway, from [the wiki page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teochew_people), Teochew population has estimated 25–30 million worldwide. So I'm not one of an almost extinct species :)

It's the same for ZeroMe and ZeroMe hub. 0gallery.bit is equal to Me.ZeroNetwork.bit. Probably you opened my 0-gallery hub first so it's a bit weird, compare to ZeroMe, a user opened ZeroMe first, downloaded a hub next.

@ulrichard: For ZeroMe there is an unofficial [0hub.bit](http://192.168.1.110:43110/0hub.bit), I don't recommend hitting the "Check me and unlock All hub.." button because the required permission can read and write your own data, some hubs may be spam, too. For the limited user space of those hub, you can check [this page](/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:hubs) on ZeroWiki
For 0-Gallery there isn't. I'm only seeding three hubs, mine, yours, and the one from the author of 0-Gallery..

@leftside: sure, but I'm not sure that the language is the same with ancient Teochew, because no audio recorder at that time, and no efficient writing script like Hangul focus on sound instead of image.
Awesome practice! Thanks! @ulrichard: you may be interested in this

> ZeroNet still able to access localhost service, e.g. 80/443 port if running nginx, or even socks proxy that allow escape of outgoing firewall

@Loopback: how is that possible? Because of tracker and something like uPnP (aka ZeroNet can keep scanning other port)? ZeroNet need trackers to discover peer, but afaik on router only 15441 port is opened for ZeroNet.
@Loopback: You're welcome. I'm not a network security expert so I don't know much about this kind of things actually.
@ulrichard: Yep, it's a medium and "help wanted" issue in the official repo: [issue #241](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/241)
@Loopback: but packages in AUR are not security-hardened, many are even non-free either not opensource.. therefore they can't make into official repo (Arch is not totally free either though)
@Loopback: Ah.. Sure! That is a very good idea!!
No one was holding **smart**phone, nice scene!
@Dextro: @Eibriel: [The Ultimate ZeroNet Mobile Guide](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:7_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h) ;)
@Eibriel: looks like it's a bot account

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: Nice list, @Laurenwutang: besides ZeroSites and Search engine, you can also discover interesting sites on Important Zites [[new]](/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E) [[old]](/15Pf9VVuDT8NSWj1qUBh4V89yPmrmzRw6a) and [0list](/0list.bit) :D

> i prefer zerome because it's a rulefree* site (*people might mute you if they dont want to see your content) diaspora still applies by laws, mastodon is just between do you want a free speech zone or be federated 

@Deepstrelok: agree! Diaspora is probably the oldest decentrailzed social network, from wiki:
> The Diaspora project was founded in 2010 by four students at New York University’s Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences, Ilya Zhitomirskiy, Dan Grippi, Max Salzberg, and Raphael Sofaer. The word diaspora is Greek in origin and refers to a scattered or dispersed population.

I have been there for more than 5 years and it's quite a nice (or civilized) place, lots of interesting and inspring content from my perspective. 

> ... all there is, is just bots...

I mute all bots I encounter there :3

@Git Center: Yep, Nofish (and some good ZeroNet app developers ;) deserves that as an award XD In contrast, bad businessman may be able to pack ZeroNet, claim it a novel proprietary technology, bad market it and earn that money..

Yep, ZeroMusic has file type limit setting in `$site/data/user/content.json` and `msgpack` is not allowed, you may like to use (ZeroLSTN](/ZeroLSTN.bit), a modern music sharing site ;) And here is [multi-upload solution](/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:68) 
> [Signierung des Inhalts fehlgeschlagen Include too large 51217B > 50000B]

This means on ZeroMusic a user has only 50000B space (text, not including optional file like mp3) and you reached your storage limit, so you need to contact the site admin to raise your limit or delete some of your old content.
@Thunder: that is "data/users/content.json", not "data/users/$USER/content.json"
@Thunder: oh, that's true! I didn't realize it before..

For multiplayer game, guess we need to remove 30 sec publishing limit first, instead adding a receiving limit setting (30 sec as default, because frequent writing are harmful to HDD, even Nofish broke a SSD..), and some nodes can set the limit to 0 and become a real-time game server

Oh, and we need to implement time consensus, a related commit: [Add current timestamp to handshake for future time consensus feature ](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/511731f0b46aaa3a94591a672e44deef525a6637), or in a dungeon game a player may hit another player or claim a treature in the future. 

Hmm, maybe it's ok that every player only stores other players' data in a specific local file, and every player has a different version of game, i.e. if a player felt unhappy, s/he could change the data and claimed s/he is the winner. But s/he can't modify another player' game data and change his result X)

@Thunder: XD, did you check my previous comment that is 5 minutes before yours, I found that we are somehow talking the same problems.

> say when b see broadcast a moves, it adds that signed move into his "file" same viceversa

Guess it will be used in the time consensus feature.

> i dont really know how to solve invalid moves unless the other declare self victory or give opponent a retry/undo ...

Yep, blockchain isn't ideal, do you think "every player only stores other players' data in a specific local file, and every player has a different version of game" is acceptable?

> maybe like a dedicated space that's suppose to be allocated in ram(lost when node switch off assuming data isnt important) to deal with the oops i killed my ssd ...

@Thunder: that's a good idea! Again the problem becomes "who wants to implement it" :3

--- ---

> yeah i can see now why i was running out of dataspace on zerotalk

Unluckily @Nofish the main dev and ZeroTalk maintainer is taking a vacation (about 1 week left), he may use an automatic script to check and increase user limit, but his computer is probably off.
@Thunder: and yep, avoiding/preventing cheating is hard, since a user can easily use scripts, bot and even AI in the game..
@Thunder: but we are talking about creating multi-player game, and we need to make the game fair or at least enjoyable to play, or it will fail..
@Thunder: yep, we can at least try to create some turnbase chess games or card games first. Chess/card games on a decentralized platform, that will be cool! Isn't it :D
@Eaglex: @jad: That ZeroMessage widget is a Pandora's box :3 F12 -> console, then open it and you will understand what I say ;)

https://etherscan.io/tx/0x2d6a7b0f6adeff38423d4c62cd8b6ccb708ddad85da5d3d06756ad4d8a04a6a2 ["It's on the blockchain. This will never disappear."](https://github.com/sikaozhe1997/Xin-Yue/issues/108#issuecomment-383845167) Awesome!

Maybe we can^TM create another zite that reads ZeroMe hubs but is only for storing tag data, and add features of showing tags and editing tag cross-site in the ZeroMe frontend (there is also sakana.bit btw) Then volunteers can add tags to posts s/he viewed and users can have an option displaying them

@Thunder: the war between spamming and anti-spamming probably never ends.. some solutions are: make spamming expensive, authorization (moderation), reputation system (reward good behavior), make everyone happy so no one is interested in spamming.. 
--- ---
> I trust Nekololi. If Nekololi shares a blacklist, I would append it to my own, by individual entries, categories or the whole list. The source of the appended entries can remain as long as I'm not altering the entries, in which case would be myself adding my two cents, thus becoming my own copy of my authorship, so then my authored entry lists me as a source.

A good idea by styromaniac from the discussion in your link

@Thunder: the idea from styromaniac is somehow a reputation system, just like ZeroMe timeline, you only follow user that you like or that is doing good behavior, or from trusted users' following list and spammers have little chance spamming it. It will be hard for new users who has no old friends on ZeroNet though

Also, maybe we don't need a strong global site, which means every ZeroNet user must have an account on a zite like ZeroMe or ZeroTalk, community can simply create/clone their own zite/version and have more peace.

Related code is in `js/PostCreate.coffee`:
```
		@upload.resize_width = 900
		@upload.resize_height = 700
```
And the solution is pretty easy:
Add a tooltip to the submit button by adding `title: "Tip: the width and height of image will be respectively resized up to 900px and 700px."`
inside
`h("div.image", {style: "background-image: url(#{@image.base64uri}); ...`

Imo they should be regarded as contribution to ZeroNet/decentralized network. You may also like to use [ZeroExchange](/ZeroExchange.bit/). Google, Stackoverflow, Quora, etc are great, but we need useful, transparent and decentralized version of them (like Yacy), to prevent all kinds of bad things..
Imo ZeroNet is a perfect place for learning and practising webdev, btw it's better to seperate/modulize code related to ZeroNet API if a dev wanted her/his code to be more reuseable

`zeronet.py siteSign $zite_address --inner_path data/users/$user_address/content.json`, btw, you can do it in the "0" config panel, simply change `content.json` to `data/users/$user_address/content.json` then sign it.
